history.proof: intros Q P f1 f2 f3 H1 f4 H2 f5 H3 a z1 z2 H4 q. sauto lq: on depth: 3.

ctx: intros Q P f1 f2 f3 H1 f4 H2 f5 H3 a z1 z2 H4 q.
tactic: apply Formula_depth_rec2 with (a := a); intros; apply H4; auto.
exceptions.exn: Abstracting over the term "a" leads to a term fun a0 : Formula => Formula_depth_rec2rec (fun x : Formula => Q x -> P x) f1 f2 f3 f4 f5 a0 z1 q = Formula_depth_rec2rec (fun x : Formula => Q x -> P x) f1 f2 f3 f4 f5 a0 z2 q which is ill-typed. Reason is: Illegal application: The term "Formula_depth_rec2rec" of type "forall P : Formula -> Set, (forall t t0 : Term, P (equal t t0)) -> (forall (r : Relations L) (t : Terms (arity L (inl r))), P (atomic r t)) -> (forall f : Formula, P f -> forall f0 : Formula, P f0 -> P (impH f f0)) -> (forall f : Formula, P f -> P (notH f)) -> (forall (v : nat) (a : Formula), (forall b : Formula, lt_depth b (forallH v a) -> P b) -> P (forallH v a)) -> forall a : Formula, (forall b : Formula, lt_depth b a -> P b) -> P a" cannot be applied to the terms "fun x : Formula => Q x -> P x" : "Formula -> Set" "f1" : "forall t t0 : Term, Q (equal t t0) -> P (equal t t0)" "f2" : "forall (r : Relations L) (t : Terms (arity L (inl r))), Q (atomic r t) -> P (atomic r t)" "f3" : "forall f : Formula, (Q f -> P f) -> forall f0 : Formula, (Q f0 -> P f0) -> Q (impH f f0) -> P (impH f f0)" "f4" : "forall f : Formula, (Q f -> P f) -> Q (notH f) -> P (notH f)" "f5" : "forall (v : nat) (a : Formula), (forall b : Formula, lt_depth b (forallH v a) -> Q b -> P b) -> Q (forallH v a) -> P (forallH v a)" "a0" : "Formula" "z1" : "forall b : Formula, lt_depth b a -> Q b -> P b" "q" : "Q a" The 8th term has type "forall b : Formula, lt_depth b a -> Q b -> P b" which should be coercible to "forall b : Formula, lt_depth b a0 -> (fun x : Formula => Q x -> P x) b".

original: intros Q P f1 f2 f3 H1 f4 H2 f5 H3 a z1 z2 H4 q. apply Formula_depth_rec2 with (a := a); intros; apply H4; auto.
